p: The found flavonoid contents ranged from 26.82 ± 1.49 µg/mL of quercetin equivalent in the T. cucumerina variety to as low as 8.20 ± 0.3 µg/mL in the B. hispida variety ( Figure 3). Furthermore, the total flavonoid content of the M. charantia sample was comparable (23.13 ± 1.33) to that of the C. metuliferus sample (22.01 ± 1.29). These results may be due to the content of flavonoid compounds such as catechin hydrate, (−)-epicatechin, phloretin, phloridzin, rutin, quercetin and kaempferol derivatives, and procyanidines.
